reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Axshya-Plus: Resilient Axshya Communities for Elimination of TB in India and mobilization of resources through multisectoral engagement

description.narrative: India - Tuberculosis - International Union Against Tuberculosis and Lung Disease - IUATLD. This program has the following goals: To achieve a rapid decline in burden of TB, morbidity and mortality to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals of 80% reduction in incidence and 90% reduction in deaths by 2025; five years earlier than the stipulated timeline.. The objectives of this program are: Demonstrate implementation models, generate evidence, and scale-up programmatic management of TB preventive treatment.. Mobilize resources and resourcefulness of various stakeholders through multisectoral convergent actions

title.narrative: Percentage of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB started on treatment for MDR-TB who were lost to follow up during the first six months of treatment
DOTS-other 1: Number of Axshya Villages established
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
TB O-other 1: Percentage of population with correct knowledge of TB
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
